what: Modelling Species Distribution in the Southern Ocean
title: Data for Southern Ocean species distribution modelling
text: Species Distribution Modelling correlative approach helps assess relationship species occurrence records surrounding environmental conditions. Studying distribution benthic species Southern Ocean constitutes interesting approach interpolate little amount information broad scale poorly accessible area. provide set environmental descriptors suitable modelling work. present vignette describes procedure select download .

title: Data for Southern Ocean species distribution modelling
text: present dataset composed 58 environmental descriptors, set 0.1 degree grid-cell resolution, Southern Ocean extent (80 45 degrees S, -180 180 degrees longitude). Layers provided netCDF file format. 1/ depth  Description: Bathymetry. title: Data for Southern Ocean species distribution modelling
text: first steps download data define directory data stored. example, use temporary folder. Now can ask blueant fetch unpack data: verbose = TRUE argument helps display progress output. completed, status object provides information files downloaded. particular, downloaded netCDF files can listed : can open data raster package  can also consult blueant vignette information.
code: library(blueant) my_data_directory <- tempdir()  ## the data source we want data_source <- sources_sdm("Southern Ocean marine environmental data")  ## put these together into a blueant configuration config <- bb_config(my_data_directory) %>% bb_add(data_source) config ## Local file root: /tmp/RtmpARc6SF  ##  ## # Data group:  Modelling  ##  ## ##  Southern Ocean marine environmental data  ## This dataset is a collection of marine environmental data layers suitable for use in Southern Ocean species distribution modelling. All environmental layers have been generated at a spatial resolution of 0.1 degrees, covering the Southern Ocean extent (80 degrees S - 45 degrees S, -180 - 180 degrees). The layers include information relating to bathymetry, sea ice, ocean currents, primary production, particulate organic carbon, and other oceanographic data. ##  ## An example of reading and using these data layers in R can be found at  https://australianantarcticdivision.github.io/blueant/articles/SO_SDM_data.html. ##  ## The following layers are provided: ##  ## 1. Layer name: depth ## Description: Bathymetry. Downloaded from GEBCO 2014 (0.0083 degrees = 30sec arcmin resolution) and set at resolution 0.1 degrees. Then completed with the bathymetry layer manually corrected and provided in Fabri-Ruiz et al. (2017) ## Value range: -8038.722 - 0 ## Units: m ##  ## Source: This study. Derived from GEBCO ## URL: https://www.gebco.net/data_and_products/gridded_bathymetry_data/ ## Citation: Fabri-Ruiz S, Saucede T, Danis B and David B (2017). Southern Ocean Echinoids database_An updated version of Antarctic, Sub-Antarctic and cold temperate echinoid database. ZooKeys, (697), 1. ##  ## 2. Layer name: geomorphology ## Description: Last update on biodiversity.aq portal. Derived from  O'Brien et al. (2009) seafloor geomorphic feature dataset. Mapping based on GEBCO contours, ETOPO2, seismic lines). 27 categories ## Value range: 27 categories ## Units: categorical ## Source: This study. Derived from Australian Antarctic Data Centre ## URL: https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/Polar_Environmental_Data ## Citation: O'Brien, P.E., Post, A.L., and Romeyn, R. (2009) Antarctic-wide geomorphology as an aid to habitat mapping and locating vulnerable marine ecosystems. CCAMLR VME Workshop 2009. Document WS-VME-09/10 ##  ## 3. Layer name: sediments ## Description: Sediment features ## Value range: 14 categories ## Units: categorical ## Source: Griffiths 2014 (unpublished) ## URL: http://share.biodiversity.aq/GIS/antarctic/ ##  ## 4. Layer name: slope ## Description: Seafloor slope derived from bathymetry with the terrain function of raster R package. Computation according to Horn (1981), ie option neighbor=8. The computation was done on the GEBCO bathymetry layer (0.0083 degrees resolution) and the resolution was then changed to 0.1 degrees. Unit set at degrees. ## Value range: 0.000252378 - 16.94809 ## Units: degrees ## Source: This study. Derived from GEBCO ## URL: https://www.gebco.net/data_and_products/gridded_bathymetry_data/ ## Citation: Horn, B.K.P., 1981. Hill shading and the reflectance map. Proceedings of the IEEE 69:14-47 ##  ## 5. Layer name: roughness ## Description: Seafloor roughness derived from bathymetry with the terrain function of raster R package. Roughness is the difference between the maximum and the minimum value of a cell and its 8 surrounding cells. The computation was done on the GEBCO bathymetry layer (0.0083 degrees resolution) and the resolution was then changed to 0.1 degrees. ## Value range: 0 - 5171.278 ## Units: unitless ## Source: This study. Derived from GEBCO ## URL: https://www.gebco.net/data_and_products/gridded_bathymetry_data/ ##  ## 6. Layer name: mixed layer depth ## Description: Summer mixed layer depth climatology from ARGOS data. Regridded from 2-degree grid using nearest neighbour interpolation ## Value range: 13.79615 - 461.5424 ## Units: m ## Source: https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/Polar_Environmental_Data ##  ## 7. Layer name: seasurface_current_speed ## Description: Current speed near the surface (2.5m depth), derived from the CAISOM model (Galton-Fenzi et al. 2012, based on ROMS model) ## Value range: 1.50E-04 - 1.7 ## Units: m/s ## Source: This study. Derived from Australian Antarctic Data Centre ## URL: https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/Polar_Environmental_Data ## Citation: see Galton-Fenzi BK, Hunter JR, Coleman R, Marsland SJ, Warner RC (2012) Modeling the basal melting and marine ice accretion of the Amery Ice Shelf. Journal of Geophysical Research: Oceans, 117, C09031. http://dx.doi.org/10.1029/2012jc008214, https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/polar_environmental_data ##  ## 8. Layer name: seafloor_current_speed ## Description: Current speed near the sea floor, derived from the CAISOM model  (Galton-Fenzi et al. 2012, based on ROMS) ## Value range: 3.40E-04 - 0.53 ## Units: m/s ## Source: This study. Derived from Australian Antarctic Data Centre ## URL: https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/Polar_Environmental_Data ## Citation: see Galton-Fenzi BK, Hunter JR, Coleman R, Marsland SJ, Warner RC (2012) Modeling the basal melting and marine ice accretion of the Amery Ice Shelf. Journal of Geophysical Research: Oceans, 117, C09031. http://dx.doi.org/10.1029/2012jc008214, https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/polar_environmental_data ##  ## 9. Layer name: distance_antarctica ## Description: Distance to the nearest part of the Antarctic continent ## Value range: 0 - 3445 ## Units: km ## Source: https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/Polar_Environmental_Data ##  ## 10. title: Blueant
text: Blueant provides set data source configurations use bowerbird package. data sources themed around Antarctic Southern Ocean data, include range oceanographic, meteorological, topographic, environmental data sets. Blueant allow download data external data providers local file system, keep data collection date.

title: Blueant
code: install.packages("devtools") library(devtools) install_github("AustralianAntarcticDivision/blueant", build_vignettes = TRUE)

previous_headings: Blueant > Usage overview
title: Blueant
text: Build configuration first defining global options destination local file system. Usually choose destination data directory persistent location suitable data library. demonstration purposes ’ll just use temporary directory: Add data sources provided blueant. summary sources given end document. ’ll use “George V bathymetry” data source example: data source fairly small (around 200MB, see mysrc$collection_size). sure check collection_size parameter chosen data source running synchronization. collections quite large (see summary table bottom document).
code: library(blueant) my_data_dir <- tempdir() cf <- bb_config(local_file_root = my_data_dir) mysrc <- sources("George V bathymetry") cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc)

title: Blueant
text: configuration defined data source added , can run sync process. set verbose = TRUE see additional progress output: Congratulations! now local copy data set. files data set stored data-source-specific subdirectory local file root: contents directory: data sources provided blueant can read, manipulated, plotted using range R packages, including RAADTools raster. case data files netcdf, can read raster:
code: status <- bb_sync(cf, verbose = TRUE) bb_data_source_dir(cf) list.files(bb_data_source_dir(cf), recursive = TRUE, full.names = TRUE) library(raster) x <- raster(file.path(bb_data_source_dir(cf), "gvdem500m_v3.nc")) plot(x)

code: src <- sources(name="CMEMS global gridded SSH reprocessed (1993-ongoing)") src$user <- "yourusername" src$password <- "yourpassword" cf <- bb_add(cf, src)  ## or, using the pipe operator mysrc <- bb_example_sources("CMEMS global gridded SSH reprocessed (1993-ongoing)") %>%   bb_modify_source(user = "yourusername", password = "yourpassword") cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc)

previous_headings: Blueant > Nuances > Writing and modifying data sources
title: Blueant
text: Sometimes might want part data collection. Perhaps want years long-term collection, perhaps data provided multiple formats need one. data source uses bb_handler_rget method, can restrict downloaded modifying arguments passed data source’s method parameter, particularly accept_follow, reject_follow, accept_download, reject_download options. example, CERSAT SSM/sea ice concentration data arranged yearly directories, fairly easy restrict , say, 2017 data: Alternatively, data sources divided subdirectories, one replace whole-data-source source_url one point specific yearly () subdirectories. example, default source_url CERSAT sea ice data ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/ (yearly subdirectories). e.g. 2016 2017 data :
code: mysrc <- sources("CERSAT SSM/I sea ice concentration")  ## first make sure that the data source doesn't already have an accept_follow parameter defined "accept_follow" %in% names(mysrc$method[[1]])  ## nope, so we can safely go ahead and impose our own mysrc$method[[1]]$accept_follow <- "/2017" cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc) mysrc <- sources("CERSAT SSM/I sea ice concentration") mysrc$source_url[[1]] <- c("ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/2016/",                         "ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/2017/") cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc)

title: Blueant
text: Global wave reanalysis describing past sea states since years 1993. product also bears name WAVERYS within GLO-HR MFC. correspondence global multi-year products like GLORYS. BIORYS. etc. core WAVERYS based MFWAM model. third generation wave model calculates wave spectrum. .e. distribution sea state energy frequency direction 1/5 degree irregular grid. Average wave quantities derived wave spectrum. SWH (significant wave height) average wave period. delivered regular 1/5 degree grid 3h time step. wave spectrum discretized 30 frequencies obtained geometric sequence first member 0.035 Hz reason 7.5. WAVERYS takes account oceanic currents GLORYS12 physical ocean reanalysis assimilates significant wave height observed historical altimetry missions directional wave spectra Sentinel 1 SAR 2017 onwards. title: Blueant
text: global importance mesopelagic fish increasingly recognised, remain poorly studied. particularly true Southern Ocean, mesopelagic fishes key predators prey, remote environment makes sampling challenging. Despite , multiple national Antarctic research programs undertaken regional sampling mesopelagic fish several decades. However, data dispersed, sampling methodologies often differ precluding comparisons limiting synthetic analyses. , collated standardised existing survey data  mesopelagic fishes circumpolar dataset called Myctobase. date, Myctobase holds 17,491 occurrence 11,190 abundance records 4780 net hauls 72 different research cruises. Data include trait-based information individuals including standard length, weight life-stage. Data span across 37 years 1991 2019. Detailed metadata also provided sampling event including  date, time, position (latitude, longitude, depth), sampling protocol, net type, net mesh size, tow speed, volume filtered haul type (routine, target, random).  dataset comprised three comma-separated files. first file (event.csv) describes survey methodology. second file (groupOccurrence.csv) contains catch data linked survey methodology event ID. final file (individualOccurrence.csv) contains measurements individuals. row contains event occurrence ID, links measurement first second file. See associated metadata record definitions units variable  'definitions.xlsx'. final dataset subject quality control validation processes. Entries ambiguous incomplete records identified '0' column labelled 'validation' (event.csv) description missing data can found proceeding column labelled 'validationDescription'. taxonomic name  individual verified  World Register Marine Species (http://www.marinespecies.org/). Approximate size: 0 GB Documentation link: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.6809070

title: Blueant
text: Retrospective Analysis Antarctic Tracking Data (RAATD) Scientific Committee Antarctic Research (SCAR) project led jointly Expert Groups Birds Marine Mammals Antarctic Biodiversity Informatics, endorsed Commission Conservation Antarctic Marine Living Resources. RAATD project team consolidated tracking data multiple species Antarctic meso- top-predators identify Areas Ecological Significance. datasets constitute compiled tracking data large number research groups worked Antarctic since 1990s. metadata record pertains “filtered” version data files. files contain position estimates processed using state-space model order estimate locations regular time intervals. technical details filtering process, consult data paper. filtering code can found https://github.com/SCAR/RAATD repository. data set comprises one metadata csv file describes deployments, along data files (3 files 17 species). species : RDS file contains fitted filter model object model predictions (file RDS format can read R statistical software package) PDF file shows quality control results individual model CSV file containing interpolated position estimates details file contents formats, consult data paper. data also available standardized version (see https://data.aad.gov.au/metadata/records/SCAR_EGBAMM_RAATD_2018_Standardised) contain position estimates provided original data collectors (generally, raw Argos GPS locations, estimated GLS locations) without state-space filtering. what: Effects of Sound on the Marine Environment
title: Blueant
text: ESME uses publically available environmental data sources provide detailed information ocean, form four primary databases supplied Oceanographic Atmospheric Master Library (OAML). (1) Bottom Sediment Type (BST) v 2.0 : database provides information type sediment ocean bottom, affects acoustic reflectivity. Available data resolutions: 2 min, 0.1 min. (2) Digital Bathymetry Database (DBDB) v 5.4 : database provides information depth water column. Available data resolutions: 2 min, 1 min, .5 min, .1 min, 0.05 min. (3) Generalized Digital Environment Model (GDEM) v 3.0 : database provides water temperature water salinity data selected month months time, used calculate changes speed sound water. Available data resolution: 15 min. (4) Surface Marine Gridded Climatology (SMGC) v 2.0 : database provides wind speed data selected month months. Wind speed, consequently surface roughness wave height, affect surface’s acoustic reflectivity. Available data resolution: 60 min. Approximate size: 5 GB Documentation link: https://esme.bu.edu/index.shtml

text: dataset comprises Digital Elevation Models (DEMs) varying resolutions George V Terre Adelie continental margin, derived incorporating available singlebeam multibeam point depth data ESRI ArcGIS grids. purpose provide revised DEMs Census Antarctic Marine Life (CAML) researchers required accurate, high-resolution depth models correlating seabed biota data physical environment. DEM processing method utilised individual multibeam singlebeam depth points converted geographic xyz (long/lat/depth) ASCII files. addition, ArcGIS line shapefile East Antarctic coastline showing grounding lines coastal glaciers floating ice shelves, converted xyz ASCII file 0 m depth value. Land elevation data utilised Radarsat Antarctic Mapping Project (RAMP) 200 m DEM data converted xyz ASCII data. depth, land coastline ASCII files input Fledermaus 3DEditor visualisation software removal noisy data. cleaned point data binned gridded surface using Fledermaus DMagic software, resulting 0.001-arcdegree (~100 m) resolution DEM holes input data exists. ArcGIS Topogrid software used interpolate across holes output full-coverage DEM. ArcGIS used produce additional 0.0025-arcdegree (~250 m) 0.005-arcdegree (~500 m) resolution grids. Full processing details can viewed : Beaman, R.J., O’Brien, P.E., Post, .L., De Santis, L., 2011. new high-resolution bathymetry model Terre Adelie George V continental margin, East Antarctica. title: Antarctic and Southern Ocean Environmental Data Sources
text: Build configuration first defining global options destination local file system. Usually choose destination data directory persistent location, suitable data library. demonstration purposes ’ll just use temporary directory: Add data sources provided blueant. summary sources given end document. ’ll use “George V bathymetry” data source example: data source fairly small (around 200MB, see mysrc$collection_size). sure check collection_size parameter chosen data source running synchronization. collections quite large (see summary table bottom document).
code: library(blueant) my_data_dir <- tempdir() cf <- bb_config(local_file_root = my_data_dir) mysrc <- sources("George V bathymetry") cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc)

previous_headings: Nuances > Writing and modifying data sources
title: Antarctic and Southern Ocean Environmental Data Sources
text: Sometimes might want part data collection. Perhaps want years long-term collection, perhaps data provided multiple formats need one. data source uses bb_handler_rget method, can restrict downloaded modifying arguments passed data source’s method parameter, particularly accept_follow, reject_follow, accept_download, reject_download options. example, CERSAT SSM/sea ice concentration data arranged yearly directories, fairly easy restrict , say, 2017 data: Alternatively, data sources divided subdirectories, one replace whole-data-source source_url one point specific yearly () subdirectories. example, default source_url CERSAT sea ice data ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/ (yearly subdirectories). e.g. 2016 2017 data :
code: mysrc <- sources("CERSAT SSM/I sea ice concentration")  ## first make sure that the data source doesn't already have an accept_follow parameter defined "accept_follow" %in% names(mysrc$method[[1]])  ## nope, so we can safely go ahead and impose our own mysrc$method[[1]]$accept_follow <- "/2017" cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc) mysrc <- sources("CERSAT SSM/I sea ice concentration") mysrc$source_url[[1]] <- c(   "ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/2016/",   "ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/cersat/products/gridded/psi-concentration/data/antarctic/daily/netcdf/2017/") cf <- cf %>% bb_add(mysrc)

previous_headings: Data source summary > Data group: Oceanographic
what: Effects of Sound on the Marine Environment
title: Antarctic and Southern Ocean Environmental Data Sources
text: ESME uses publically available environmental data sources provide detailed information ocean, form four primary databases supplied Oceanographic Atmospheric Master Library (OAML). (1) Bottom Sediment Type (BST) v 2.0 : database provides information type sediment ocean bottom, affects acoustic reflectivity. Available data resolutions: 2 min, 0.1 min. (2) Digital Bathymetry Database (DBDB) v 5.4 : database provides information depth water column. Available data resolutions: 2 min, 1 min, .5 min, .1 min, 0.05 min. (3) Generalized Digital Environment Model (GDEM) v 3.0 : database provides water temperature water salinity data selected month months time, used calculate changes speed sound water. Available data resolution: 15 min. (4) Surface Marine Gridded Climatology (SMGC) v 2.0 : database provides wind speed data selected month months. Wind speed, consequently surface roughness wave height, affect surface’s acoustic reflectivity. Available data resolution: 60 min. Approximate size: 5 GB Documentation link: https://esme.bu.edu/index.shtml

FSLEs highlight transport barriers control horizontal exchange water eddy cores. title: Oceanographic data sources — sources_oceanographic
text: "CSIRO Atlas Regional Seas 2009": CARS digital climatology, atlas seasonal ocean water properties "World Ocean Atlas 2009": World Ocean Atlas 2009 included convenience superseded World Ocean Atlas 2013 V2 "World Ocean Atlas 2013 V2": World Ocean Atlas 2013 version 2 (WOA13 V2) set objectively analyzed (1 degree grid) climatological fields situ temperature, salinity, dissolved oxygen, Apparent Oxygen Utilization (AOU), percent oxygen saturation, phosphate, silicate, nitrate standard depth levels annual, seasonal, monthly compositing periods World Ocean. also includes associated statistical fields observed oceanographic profile data interpolated standard depth levels 5 degree, 1 degree, 0.25 degree grids "World Ocean Atlas 2018": World Ocean Atlas (WOA) collection objectively analyzed, quality controlled temperature, salinity, oxygen, phosphate, silicate, nitrate means based profile data World Ocean Database (WOD). can used create boundary /initial conditions variety ocean models, verify numerical simulations ocean, corroborate satellite data "Argo ocean basin data (USGODAE)": Argo float data Global Data Access Centre Monterey, USA (US Global Ocean Data Assimilation Experiment). multi-profile netcdf files divided ocean basin. Accepts region parameter values "pacific" (default), "atlantic", /"indian". Also accepts years parameter: optional vector years download data "Argo profile data": Argo profile data, default Global Data Access Centre Monterey, USA (US Global Ocean Data Assimilation Experiment). DAC can changed specifying dac_url parameter (see example ). Also see bb_handler_argo description parameters source accepts. "Roemmich-Gilson Argo Climatology": basic description modern upper ocean based entirely Argo data available , provide baseline comparison past datasets ongoing Argo data, test adequacy Argo sampling large-scale variability, examine consistency Argo dataset related ocean observations programs "Effects Sound Marine Environment": ESME uses publically available environmental data sources provide detailed information ocean: (1) Bottom Sediment Type (BST) v 2.0, (2) Digital Bathymetry Database (DBDB) v 5.4, (3) Generalized Digital Environment Model (GDEM) v 3.0, (4) Surface Marine Gridded Climatology (SMGC) v 2.0" returned tibble contains information source.

text: See doc_url citation field row returned tibble references associated particular data sources

title: Oceanographic data sources — sources_oceanographic
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ## define a configuration and add the Atlas of Regional Seas data to it cf <- bb_config("/my/file/root") src <- sources_oceanographic("CSIRO Atlas of Regional Seas 2009") cf <- bb_add(cf,src)  ## Argo data, Pacific ocean basin only, all years src <- sources_oceanographic("Argo ocean basin data (USGODAE)", region="pacific")  ## Argo data, Pacific ocean basin for 2018 only src <- sources_oceanographic("Argo ocean basin data (USGODAE)",   region="pacific", years=2018)  ## Argo data, all ocean basins and for 2017 and 2018 only src <- sources_oceanographic("Argo ocean basin data (USGODAE)",   region=c("pacific", "indian", "atlantic"), years=c(2017, 2018))  ## Argo merge profile data, from the French GDAC (ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/argo/) ## Only download profiles from institutions "CS" or "IN", south of 30S, ##  with parameter "NITRATE" or "CHLA" src <- sources_oceanographic("Argo profile data", profile_type = "merge",                              dac_url = "ftp://ftp.ifremer.fr/ifremer/argo/",                              institutions = c("CS", "IN"),                              latitude_filter = function(z) z < -30,                              parameters = c("CHLA", "NITRATE")) } # }

title: Sea ice data sources — sources_seaice
text: Data sources providing (primarily satellite-derived) sea ice data: "Sea Ice Concentrations Nimbus-7 SMMR DMSP SSM/-SSMIS Passive Microwave Data, Version 2". Passive microwave estimates sea ice concentration 25km spatial resolution. Daily monthly resolution, available 1-Oct-1978 near-present. Data undergo quality checking process updated annually. Available netcdf format. Accepts hemisphere values "south", "north", "". recent data available via 'Near-Real-Time DMSP SSMIS Daily Polar Gridded Sea Ice Concentrations, Version 2' source "Near-Real-Time DMSP SSMIS Daily Polar Gridded Sea Ice Concentrations, Version 2". Near-real-time passive microwave estimates sea ice concentration 25km, daily resolution. Available netcdf format. Accepts hemisphere values "south", "north", "". Accepts time_resolution values "day" "month". Accepts years parameter vector years. "NSIDC passive microwave supporting files": Grids support files NSIDC passive microwave sea ice data "Nimbus Ice Edge Points Nimbus Visible Imagery": data set (NmIcEdg2) estimates location North South Pole sea ice edges various times mid late 1960s, based recovered Nimbus 1 (1964), Nimbus 2 (1966), Nimbus 3 (1969) visible imagery "Artist AMSR-E sea ice concentration": Passive microwave estimates daily sea ice concentration 6.25km spatial resolution, 19-Jun-2002 2-Oct-2011. Previously accepted formats "geotiff" /"hdf", now ignored (file format available now netcdf) "Artist AMSR2 near-real-time sea ice concentration": Near-real-time passive microwave estimates daily sea ice concentration 6.25km spatial resolution, 24-July-2012 present "Artist AMSR2 near-real-time 3.125km sea ice concentration": Near-real-time passive microwave estimates daily sea ice concentration 3.125km spatial resolution, 24-July-2012 present "Artist AMSR2 supporting files": Grids landmasks Artist AMSR2 passive microwave sea ice data "CERSAT SSM/sea ice concentration": Passive microwave sea ice concentration data 12.5km resolution, 3-Dec-1991 present "CERSAT SSM/sea ice concentration supporting files": Grids CERSAT SSM/sea ice concentration data "Sea ice lead climatologies": Long-term relative sea ice lead frequencies Arctic (November - April 2002/03 - 2018/19) Antarctic (April - September 2003 - 2019) derived Moderate-Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) imagery "MODIS Composite Based Maps East Antarctic Fast Ice Coverage": Maps East Antarctic landfast sea-ice extent, generated approx. 250,000 1 km visible/thermal infrared cloud-free MODIS composite imagery (augmented AMSR-E 6.25-km sea-ice concentration composite imagery required). Coverage 2000-03-01 2008-12-31 "Circum-Antarctic landfast sea ice extent": maps Antarctic landfast sea ice, derived NASA MODIS imagery. 24 maps per year, spanning 18 year period March 2000 Feb 2018 "National Ice Center Antarctic daily sea ice charts": USNIC Daily Ice Edge product depicts daily sea ice pack red (8-10/10ths greater sea ice), Marginal Ice Zone (MIZ) yellow. marginal ice zone transition open ocean (ice free) pack ice. MIZ dynamic affects air-ocean heat transport, well significant factor navigational safety. daily ice edge analyzed sea ice experts using multiple sources near real time satellite data, derived satellite products, buoy data, weather, analyst interpretation current sea ice conditions. product current depiction location ice edge vice satellite derived ice edge product. Accepts formats parameter can one "filled" "vector". Accepts years parameter restrict data certain years "Polarview Sentinel-1 imagery": Sentinel-1 imagery polarview.aq. Accepts acquisition_date parameter (default last four days including today), formats parameter (one "jpg", "geotiff", default ), polygon parameter, polygon within search - either WKT polygon string EPSG:3031 projection, object class sfc_POLYGON, converted WKT string internally "ATLAS/ICESat-2 L3B Daily Monthly Gridded Sea Ice Freeboard, Version 5": daily monthly gridded estimates sea ice freeboard, derived ATLAS/ICESat-2 L3A Sea Ice Freeboard (ATL10) along-track freeboard estimates "NOAA/NSIDC Climate Data Record Passive Microwave Sea Ice Concentration, Version 4": Climate Data Record sea ice concentration passive microwave data. CDR algorithm output rule-based combination ice concentration estimates two well-established algorithms: NASA Team (NT) algorithm (Cavalieri et al. 1984) NASA Bootstrap (BT) algorithm (Comiso 1986). CDR consistent, daily monthly time series sea ice concentrations 25 October 1978 recent processing "Near-Real-Time NOAA/NSIDC Climate Data Record Passive Microwave Sea Ice Concentration, Version 2": near-real-time Climate Data Record (CDR) sea ice concentration passive microwave data. Near-real-time NOAA/NSIDC Climate Data Record Passive Microwave Sea Ice Concentration (NRT CDR) data set near-real-time version final NOAA/NSIDC Climate Data Record Passive Microwave Sea Ice Concentration. NRT CDR designed fill temporal gap updates final CDR, occurring every three six months, provide recent data "OSI SAF Global Low Resolution Sea Ice Drift": ice motion vectors time span 48 hours estimated advanced cross-correlation method (Continuous MCC, CMCC) pairs satellite images. merged (multi-sensor) dataset provided

title: Topographical data sources — sources_topography
text: "Smith Sandwell bathymetry": Global seafloor topography satellite altimetry ship depth soundings "GEBCO 2014 bathymetry": Global bathymetric grid 30 arc-second intervals "GEBCO 2019 bathymetry": Global bathymetric grid 15 arc-second intervals "GEBCO 2021 bathymetry": GEBCO_2021 Grid global terrain model ocean land, providing elevation data, meters, 15 arc-second interval grid. includes number additonal data sets compared GEBCO_2020 Grid. grid accompanied Type Identifier (TID) Grid, giving information types source data GEBCO_2021 Grid based . primary GEBCO_2021 grid contains land ice surface elevation information - provided previous GEBCO grid releases. addition, 2021 release, made available version -ice topography/bathymetry information Greenland Antarctica "GEBCO 2024 bathymetry": GEBCO_2024 Grid global terrain model ocean land, providing elevation data, meters, 15 arc-second interval grid 43200 rows x 86400 columns, giving 3,732,480,000 data points. data values pixel-centre registered .e. refer elevations, meters, centre grid cells. "ETOPO1 bathymetry": ETOPO1 1 arc-minute global relief model Earth's surface integrates land topography ocean bathymetry "ETOPO2 bathymetry": 2-Minute Gridded Global Relief Data (ETOPO2v2c) "Bedmap2": Bedmap2 suite gridded products describing surface elevation, ice-thickness sea floor subglacial bed elevation Antarctic south 60S "Revision Kerguelen Plateau bathymetric grid": digital elevation model (DEM) Kerguelen Plateau region. Superseded "AusBathyTopo (Kerguelen Plateau) 100m 2022" "AusBathyTopo (Kerguelen Plateau) 100m 2022": bathymetry (depth) products compilation available source bathymetry data within Kerguelen Plateau 100 m-resolution Digital Elevation Mode. Supersedes "Revision Kerguelen Plateau bathymetric grid" "George V bathymetry": Digital Elevation Models (DEMs) varying resolutions George V Terre Adelie continental margin, derived incorporating available singlebeam multibeam point depth data "Geoscience Australia multibeam bathymetric grids Macquarie Ridge": compilation processed multibeam bathymetry data publicly available Geoscience Australia's data holding Macquarie Ridge "IBCSO bathymetry": International Bathymetric Chart Southern Ocean (IBCSO) Version 1.0 digital bathymetric model portraying seafloor circum-Antarctic waters south 60S. IBCSO Version 1.0 compiled available bathymetric data collectively gathered 30 institutions 15 countries, including multibeam single-beam echo soundings, digitized depths nautical charts, regional bathymetric gridded compilations, predicted bathymetry "IBCSO chart printing": IBCSO Poster, 2013, polar stereographic view Southern Ocean displaying bathymetric contours south 60S scale 1:7,000,000 "IBCSOv2 bathymetry": International Bathymetric Chart Southern Ocean Version 2 (IBCSO v2) digital bathymetric model area south 50S special emphasis bathymetry Southern Ocean. IBCSO v2 resolution 500 m x 500 m Polar Stereographic projection. total data coverage seafloor 23.79% multibeam-data coverage 22.32%. remaining 1.47% include singlebeam data. IBCSO v2 authoritative seafloor map area south 50S. "IBCSO 2024 Annual Release": LONGER AVAILABLE - 2024 update IBCSOv2 "IBCSO Annual Release": rolling annual update IBCSOv2. Note annual release rolling product, means new version replaces existing one old one becomes unavailable. "RTOPO-1 Antarctic ice shelf topography": consistent dataset Antarctic ice sheet topography, cavity geometry, global bathymetry "Radarsat Antarctic digital elevation model V2": high-resolution Radarsat Antarctic Mapping Project (RAMP) digital elevation model (DEM) combines topographic data variety sources provide consistent coverage Antarctica. Version 2 improves upon original version incorporating new topographic data, error corrections, extended coverage, modifications "New Zealand Regional Bathymetry 2016": LONGER AVAILABLE - NZ 250m gridded bathymetric data set imagery, Mitchell et al. 2012, released 2016 "Cryosat-2 digital elevation model": digital elevation model Antarctica derived 6 years continuous CryoSat-2 measurements "Natural Earth 10m physical vector data": Natural Earth public domain map dataset available 1:10m, 1:50m, 1:110 million scales "GSHHG coastline data": Global Self-consistent, Hierarchical, High-resolution Geography Database "Shuttle Radar Topography Mission elevation data SRTMGL1 V3": Global 1-arc-second topographic data generated NASA's Shuttle Radar Topography Mission. Version 3.0 (aka SRTM Plus Void Filled) removes void areas incorporating data sources ASTER GDEM "Reference Elevation Model Antarctica mosaic tiles": Reference Elevation Model Antarctica (REMA) high resolution, time-stamped digital surface model Antarctica 8-meter spatial resolution (reduced-resolution, resampled versions). Accepts single spatial_resolution value "1km", "200m" (default), "100m", "8m" "EGM2008 GIS Data": Global 2.5 Minute Geoid Undulations. "AAS_4116_Coastal_Complexity": dataset provides characterisation Antarctic coastal complexity. point, complexity metric calculated length scales 1 256 km, giving multiscale estimate magnitude direction undulation complexity point location along entire coastline. returned tibble contains information source.
